main.title: Application Overview
main.body:
Welcome to Inventory Management System. This application helps you manage inventory items, track suppliers, and analyze stock movements.

Key sections:
• Inventory: View, create, edit, and delete inventory items. Adjust quantities and prices.
• Suppliers: Manage your list of suppliers and their contact information.
• Analytics: View key performance indicators, stock trends, financial summaries, and low-stock alerts.

Tip: Use the search bar in each section to quickly find items or suppliers. Click the settings icon in the sidebar to customize your preferences (date format, number format, table density).

overview.title: Inventory Overview
overview.body:
This screen provides a complete view of your inventory data and all related actions.

• Select an item: Click any item in the list to prepare actions such as editing, adjusting quantity, deleting, or changing prices.

• Create new items: Use the "Add new item" button to register new merchandise in the system.

• Quick actions: The top toolbar allows direct access to editing, deleting, adjusting quantities, and changing prices for the selected item.

• Search & filtering: Use the search field to quickly locate items by name.

• Navigating to details: Some actions (such as Edit or Adjust Quantity) will open dialogs with contextual help available.

This page serves as the central hub for managing all inventory activities.

editItem.title: Edit Inventory Item
editItem.body:
Edit item details including:
• Item Name: The name of the inventory item
• Code/SKU: Unique identifier for the item
• Supplier: Which supplier provides this item
• Minimum Quantity: The low-stock threshold
• Unit Cost: Cost per unit (affects financial calculations)

Changes are saved immediately and will be reflected in all reports and analytics. The update timestamp is recorded for audit purposes.

deleteItem.title: Delete Item
deleteItem.body:
Permanently remove an item from your inventory system.

Important: This action cannot be undone. When you delete an item:
• It will be removed from all reports and analytics
• Historical data for this item will be archived
• You won't be able to select this item in new transactions

Proceed with caution, especially for items with transaction history.

adjustQuantity.title: Adjust Quantity
adjustQuantity.body:
Manually adjust the on-hand quantity for an inventory item.

When adjusting, you must:
• Enter the adjustment reason (Physical count, Damage, Theft, etc.)
• Provide the quantity change (positive for additions, negative for reductions)

Adjustments are tracked for audit purposes and will appear in the Analytics section under 'Recent Stock Updates'. This helps maintain inventory accuracy and accountability.

changePrice.title: Change Price
changePrice.body:
Update the unit cost or selling price for an item.

Benefits of tracking price changes:
• Historical prices are maintained for accurate financial reporting
• You can analyze cost trends over time
• Financial analytics (COGS, profitability) use price history
• Reports show price-adjusted inventory values

Price changes are effective immediately for new transactions and reports.

manage.title: Manage Suppliers
manage.body:
View and manage your complete list of suppliers.

In the Suppliers section you can:
• View all supplier information (name, contact, email, phone)
• Create new suppliers by clicking 'Add New Supplier'
• Edit supplier details
• Delete suppliers
• Filter and search suppliers

Suppliers are used to organize your inventory items. Each item is linked to a supplier, which helps with analysis, purchasing, and organization.

delete.title: Delete Supplier
delete.body:
Remove a supplier from your system.

What happens when you delete:
• The supplier record is permanently removed
• Existing inventory items remain, but are no longer linked to this supplier
• You cannot select this supplier for new items
• Historical data and transactions remain intact

This is useful when you stop working with a supplier or need to clean up your supplier list.

overview.title: Analytics Dashboard
overview.body:
The Analytics section provides insights into your inventory and business metrics.

Key features:
• Overview: Dashboard with key metrics and visualizations
• Inventory: Stock value, trends, and per-supplier breakdown
• Pricing: Price trends and cost analysis
• Finance: Financial summaries, COGS, and profitability metrics

Use the filter bar to:
• Select a supplier (or view all suppliers)
• Choose a date range for analysis

All charts and tables respect your preferred date format and number format from Settings.

preferences.title: Settings
preferences.body:
Customize your application experience with these preferences:

• Date Format: Choose how dates are displayed (DD.MM.YYYY, YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY). Used throughout the app in tables, reports, and forms.
• Number Format: Choose number formatting (German: 1.234,56 or US: 1,234.56). Affects all numeric displays including prices and quantities.
• Table Density: Choose comfortable spacing (standard) or compact display for data grids.

System Info:
View information about your application and database setup, including version, environment, and database type.
